messages.message:
So I'm sure that we've all seen fonts render a bit thinner in Figma than in our browsers. Apparently it's well documented and there's a fix: https://forum.figma.com/t/font-in-browser-seem-bolder-than-in-the-figma/24656/6 and I can confirm that it works on Chrome and Safari (but not Firefox...?)
I'm about to make this change for the new home page because that's where the problem was the most noticeable, but it also makes a lot of sense to make a change on the top styling layer, since it affects all our pages. Is anyone opposed to this idea?

One caveat to the top layer approach - I think I need to do something like
`document.querySelector('body').style.cssText = // the css string`
because that's the only element that contains everything (e.g. the page, toasts, modals, dropdown containers).

this has always bothered me!!! the designs always look better than the implementation :lolcry: thank you for getting ot the bottom of this!

i’d vote for applying the css setting on the top layer - even though doing it via `document.querySelector` isn’t ideal, i think it’s worth it
Wow!! Thank you for finding the solution.
Do we have a CSS stylesheet? If we do, we can avoid using JS to inject the styling!

A few options:
1. add to our flask html template `webserver/shared/src/py/templates/base-layout.html`
2. add to aihub frontend css `webserver/shared/src/js/webpacked/lib/src/AIHub/PageWrapper/styles.css`
